content.body: Hixie: I <3 the split/rename of the Web Browsers section
Hixie: I was just about to file a bug when I noticed it
missed that
arguably in complete.html some Web application APIs should be under that new section...
if srcdoc implies <!doctype html> I think text/html-sandboxed should too
annevk: text/html-sandboxed and srcdoc have totally different purposes
I don't see the relation
othermaciej, I think the idea is that since text/html-sandboxed is a new MIME type without the legacy issues of text/html, then documents served as such should be rendered in standards mode
I'm not sure whether or not that's a good idea though
yeah, I can see the potential benefit
on the other hand, it effectively introduces a third syntax
for just one minor difference
That would have a bad save-as story, unless the mime-type comes with a new file type suffix as well
you'd probably want a new suffix for the sake of Web servers that bind by extension
"Sorry, but document conformance can't depend on something for which no process is defined."
si-p: With the latest mercurial head I see one failure, a known issue with BeautifulSoup. What version are you running?
actually has to go for a bit but should be around later on
hi, is there a way (similar to commit_on_success) that can commit a transaction every 100:th save that's made?
would be a great way to speed up my bulk inserts, but still allow me to break them off halfway if needed
ehm... that was NOT in the right channel, sorry
othermaciej, well, we introduce a new syntax for srcdoc
othermaciej, would make sense to me if text/html-sandboxed uses the same
